SRP.A: The peak of  Soft Drinks is to the {right} of the peak of Coffee.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Coffee} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =6285.8?
EVJ.A: At X =6285.8,the label with the highest density is {Coffee}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 53060? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Bottled Water}'s peak at {72453},{Alcoholic Beverages}'s peak at {65240}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 40765? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Soft Drinks}'s peak at {17317},{Coffee}'s peak at {13714},{Juices}'s peak at {22222}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Coffee or Alcoholic Beverages?
NC.A: {Alcoholic Beverages} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Coffee or Bottled Water?
NC.A: {Bottled Water} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Coffee or Soft Drinks?
NC.A: {Soft Drinks} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Coffee}
